title: Sikh outfits demand action against culprits
text:
Parveen Arora
Tribune News Service
Karnal, October 17
Condemning the incident of desecration of a ‘bir’ of Guru Granth Sahib in Punjab and police action over protesters, hundreds of Sikhs from various Sikh organisations took out a procession in the city today. They demanded action against the culprits responsible for the act and a high-level probe into the incident. They handed over a memorandum to ADC Girish Arora for President Pranab Mukherjee. Meanwhile, they burnt the effigies of Punjab Chief Minister Parkash Singh Badal and SGPC chief Avtar Sigh Makkar. Protesters assembled at the Dera Kar Sewa and marched towards Mini Secretariat, which passed through various roads of the city. The procession was taken out when Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar was in the city. Protest led by Baba Sukha Singh, Pritpal Singh Pannu and Bhupinder Singh Assandh claimed the desecration of a ‘bir’ of Guru Granth Sahib was a heinous crime, which would not be tolerated at any cost. Protest march taken out
Ambala: The Shiromani Akali Dal Haryana Pradesh and a few other Sikh organisations took out a protest march in Ambala City to protest against the alleged desecration of the holy book in Kotkapura a few days ago. Later, they submitted a memorandum to the SDM addressed to the Governor. The members of the Akali Dal gathered at Gurdwara Manji Sahib this morning. They also raised slogans against the Punjab government and demanded arrest of the officials “responsible” for the killing of two Sikh activists in the firing. SGPC member Harpal Singh Pali, who was leading the protest march, criticised the Punjab police for killing two Sikh activists. Badal’s effigy burnt
Sirsa: Members of the Sikh community today blocked roads near Dharampura and Kewal villages of the Odhan Block in Sirsa and burnt the effigy of Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal against firing on Sikhs in Punjab and demanding arrest of those responsible for the sacrilege act.
